title: New Jersey Weighs $1.5 Billion in Credit Bets Managed by Goldman Sachs
sub_head: The state pension system is considering an increase in private credit investments through two separately managed accounts
body:
The New Jersey Division of Investment is weighing whether to commit $1.5 billion in public pension assets to two separately managed accounts run by Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s asset management arm in a bid to rapidly expand its private-credit portfolio.
The division’s investment staff proposed a $1 billion commitment for a vehicle that would invest in broadly syndicated loans and $500 million for one that provides specialty finance and opportunistic loans as well as senior and mezzanine credit strategies, according to documents...
